item.title: Shell: Create a comma separated string
item.description: foo-0,foo-1,foo-2 n=3 for i in $(seq 0 $(($n > 0? $n-1: 0))); do echo "foo-$i" done foo-0 foo-1 foo-2 n=3 combined="" for i in $(seq 0 $(($n > 0? $n-1: 0))); do token="foo-$i" combined="${combined}${combined:+,}$token" done echo $combined foo-0,foo-1,foo-2 n=3 combined="" for i in $(seq 0 $(($n > 0 ? $n-1: 0))); do token="foo-$i" combined="${combined}${combined:+,}$token" echo $combined done foo-0 foo-0,foo-1 foo-0,foo-1,foo-2

item.title: F#: Useful for scripting
item.description: We had the need to do a bit of scripting recently to change the names of the folders where we store our artifacts to signify which artifacts were created from our build’s production branch and which were generated from the main branch. The problem we had was that we were ending up overwriting old artifacts from the main branch with the production branch’s artifacts so we wanted to fix this.
